alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Kaibab Plateau; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 1:30PM MST until February 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and very strong winds expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches above 6000 feet, with lesser amounts of 2 to 6 inches down to 5000 feet and across northeastern Arizona. Winds gusting from 60 to 70 mph will cause very dangerous travel with blizzard like conditions, regardless of snowfall accumulations. * WHERE...Areas near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Fredonia, Ganado, Heber-Overgaard, Jacob Lake, Pinetop-Lakeside, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Sedona, Seligman, Shonto, Show Low, Valle, Whiteriver, Williams and Window Rock. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. Snow forecast from 9 PM Today to 11 PM Wednesday: Alpine 9 to 13 inches Buffalo Pass 8 to 12 inches Doney Park 5 to 9 inches Flagstaff 9 to 13 inches Forest Lakes 15 to 21 inches Fredonia 1 to 3 inches Ganado 2 to 4 inches Heber-Overgaard 5 to 9 inches Jacob Lake 9 to 13 inches Pinetop-Lkside 7 to 11 inches Prescott 3 to 5 inches Prescott Valley 1 to 3 inches Sedona 1 to 3 inches Seligman 1 to 2 inches Shonto 3 to 5 inches Show Low 5 to 9 inches Valle 2 to 4 inches Whiteriver 2 to 4 inches Williams 7 to 11 inches Window Rock 3 to 5 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
